contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2011}} {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Human Being | Type = studio | Longtype = | Artist = [[Seal (musician)|Seal]] | Cover = Efacd250fca00c8461886010.L.jpg|250px | Released = November 16, 1998 | Recorded = 1996–1998 | Genre = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Soul music|soul]] | Length = 51:35 | Label = [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]] | Producer = [[Trevor Horn]] | Last album = ''[[Seal (1994 album)|Seal]]''<br />(1994) | This album = ''Human Being''<br />(1998) | Next album = ''[[Seal (2003 album)|Seal]]''<br />(2003) }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref name="AMG">{{cite web|last=Prato |first=Greg |url={{Allmusic|class=album |id=r378918 |pure_url=yes}} |title=Human Being - Seal |publisher=Allmusic |date=1998-11-17 |accessdate=2012-05-20}}</ref> |rev2 = ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' |rev2Score = B+<ref>{{cite web|author=David Browne |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,63793,00.html |title=Human Being Review |publisher=''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' |date=1998-11-16 |accessdate=2012-05-20}}</ref> |rev3 = ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' |rev3score = {{Rating|2.5|5}}<ref name=RS>{{cite web|author=Evelyn McDonnell |url=http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/seal/albums/album/101808/review/5945096/human_being |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20071002033500/http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/seal/albums/album/101808/review/5945096/human_being |archivedate=2007-10-02 |title=Seal: Human Being : Music Reviews |publisher=''[[Rolling Stone]]'' |date=1998-11-17 |accessdate=2012-05-20}}</ref> }}<!-- Automatically generated by DASHBot--> '''''Human Being''''' is the third album by [[Seal (musician)|Seal]]. It was released in 1998 as a tribute to the murdered rappers [[Tupac Shakur]] and [[Biggie Smalls]]. ''Human Being'' received mixed reviews ranging from being panned for its overtly dark and moody feel,<ref name=RS/> to being described in terms such as "pop perfection."<ref name="AMG"/> The album failed to sell in the same way as his 1994 multi-platinum album, ''[[Seal (1994 album)|Seal]]''. The album features Seal '''naked''' on the cover, and the Japanese import cover features him '''with clothes on'''. A remix of "Lost My Faith" was featured over the [[closing credits]] of the 1999 film ''[[Entrapment (film)|Entrapment]]'', and the song's single release was accompanied by a music video in which Seal is integrated into scenes from the film alongside [[Sean Connery]] and [[Catherine Zeta-Jones]]. ==Track listing== #"Human Beings" (Seal) – 4:36 #"State of Grace" (Seal, Chris Bruce) – 5:00 #"Latest Craze" (Seal, [[Earl Harvin]]) – 4:28 #"Just Like You Said" (Seal, Chris Bruce) – 4:14 #"Princess" (Seal) – 1:58 #"Lost My Faith" (Seal, [[Reggie Hamilton (jazz)|Reggie Hamilton]]) – 4:35 #"Excerpt From" (Seal) – 3:04 #"When a Man Is Wrong" (Seal) – 4:18 #"Colour" (Seal) – 5:22 #"Still Love Remains" (Seal) – 5:54 #"No Easy Way" (Seal) – 4:48 #"Human Beings (Reprise)" (Seal) – 3:21 ==Personnel== * Seal – vocals, guitars, bass * [[Earl Harvin]] – drums, bass, guitars * Chris Bruce – guitars, bass * [[Jamie Muhoberac]] – keyboards, bass * Additional keyboards – [[Dave Palmer (American keyboardist)|Dave Palmer]], Grant Mitchell, [[David Sancious]], [[Mike Garson]], George De Angelis, [[Lisa Coleman (musician)|Lisa Coleman]] * Additional guitars – Gregg Arreguin, Chester Kayman, Gus Isadore, [[Wendy Melvoin]], Ramon Stagnaro, [[Danny Saber]] * Percussion – [[Alex Acuña]], Andy Duncan * Programming – Grant Mitchell, Jamie Muhoberac, Andy Richards, Dave McCracken, [[Danny Saber]], [[William Orbit]] * String Arrangements – [[Anne Dudley]], Wil Malone, [[Aaron Zigman]], [[Nick Ingman]] ==References== {{Reflist}} * Other references for Track listing and Personnel sections are from the album liner notes {{Seal (musician)}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Human Being (Album)}} [[Category:1998 albums]] [[Category:Seal albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Trevor Horn]] [[Category:Warner Bros. Records albums]] {{1990s-R&B-album-stub}}
